column4: is there anything, built in to ubuntu, or easily installable, to allow me to performance check my system?   I just doubled up the memory on this old desktop, and am wondering if there is a quantitative way to see if it did any good.
run an intensive program like a prime number finder
that would work for the mem... but step two in my update process is to add a better videocard.  would like to have one app to run, and check system.  then do it again after the next update.
well no matter what, don't depend on glxgears
